assignments.a2

Class LHD2Recurrence

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignments.a2.LHD2Recurrence

  • public class LHD2Recurrence
extends java.lang.Object
    This represents a linearly homogeneous degree-2 recurrence relation of the form:

    a(n) = c1*a(n-1) + c2*a(n-2)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LHD2Recurrence(double r1, double r2, double a1, double a2)
      Constructs a second-degree linearly homogeneous recurrence relation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getExplicitSequenceAsString()
      a(n) = u (root_1 ^ n) + v (root_2 ^ n)
      double getExplicitSequenceElement(int n)
      Returns the element at n using the calculated explicit sequence.
      java.lang.String getExplicitSequenceElementsAsString(int start, int end)
      Generates a formatted String for sequence values between two indicies using the calculated explict sequence.
      java.lang.String getRecursiveSequenceAsString()
      a(n) = r1 * a(n-1) + r2 * a(n-2)
      double getRecursiveSequenceElement(int n)
      Returns the element at n using the recursive sequence.
      java.lang.String getRecursiveSequenceElementsAsString(int start, int end)
      Generates a formatted String for sequence values between two indicies using the recurisve sequence.

        Parameters:
        r1 - The a(n-1) constant.
        r2 - The a(n-2) constant.
        a1 - The first element in the sequence.
        a2 - The second element in the sequence.

        public double getExplicitSequenceElement(int n)

        Parameters:
        n - The sequence index.
        Returns:
        The nth element's value: truncated to integer.

      • getRecursiveSequenceElement

        Returns the element at n using the recursive sequence.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getExplicitSequenceElementsAsString

        public java.lang.String getExplicitSequenceElementsAsString(int start,
                                                            int end)
        Generates a formatted String for sequence values between two indicies using the calculated explict sequence.
        Parameters:
        start - The first index in the sequence.
        end - The last index in the sequence.
        Returns:
        A formatted String of all values between start and end of the explicit sequence, inclusive.

      • getRecursiveSequenceElementsAsString

        public java.lang.String getRecursiveSequenceElementsAsString(int start,

        Generates a formatted String for sequence values between two indicies using the recurisve sequence.
        Parameters:
        start - The first index in the sequence.
        end - The last index in the sequence.
        Returns:
        A formatted String of all values between start and end of the recursive sequence, inclusive.
